posts.name: Carlos Gross Jones
posts.cooked:
I have the Beelink N5095, running latest stable Photonvision on top of Ubuntu Server 22.04.1. I‚Äôm currently experimenting with OV9281 and AR0144 USB cameras.

It runs fine for about 70% of the time, but occasionally, for seemingly no reason, the CPU speed will throttle way down, causing the FPS to drop to 5 or so.

I‚Äôve played around with the usual tools, but the actual CPU speed doesn‚Äôt seem to respect the software governor, or any minimums that I set:

I‚Äôve also played around in the BIOS, up to and including turning SpeedStep off, but without apparent effect.

Any ideas?

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Mere hours of work can save you entire minutes of planning

posts.name: Carlos Gross Jones
posts.cooked: Could be, but it seems weird that @asid61 et al. didn‚Äôt have similar issues, considering it‚Äôs the same hardware (unless Beelink made some quiet design changes somewhere, which isn‚Äôt impossible).

posts.name: jdao
posts.cooked: I would try opening your Beelink and see if the termal solution was applied properly if it ends up being a thermal issue.

posts.name: Anand Rajamani
posts.cooked:
Hm I haven‚Äôt seen this even running it for hours. How long does it take for this to be an issue? Could you limit the max frequency to 2GHz to mitigate the heat? Have you measured CPU temp?

I would definitely look at replacing thermal paste.

posts.name: Carlos Gross Jones
posts.cooked:
Well, I‚Äôll be darned-- I opened it up to find that the fan connector was unplugged. One more thing to double-check when you order from Amazon, I guess.

Oddly, I had checked the thermal data (with lm-sensors ) and it looked reasonable-- 85 C or so actual, and a limit of 105 C. Maybe the temp sensors aren‚Äôt positioned very close to the actual CPU, or something.

posts.name: Matt
posts.cooked: Well that‚Äôs a unique failure mode, LOL. Glad it was an easy fix!

posts.name: Anand Rajamani
posts.cooked: If you look at my guide there‚Äôs a recommendation on robustification, but I don‚Äôt know if put ‚Äúglue the fan connector‚Äù on there. Thank you for checking this failure mode!
